solution_line_template: The 2 VIP tickets amount to ${vip_ticket_price} x {num_vip_tickets} = $<<{vip_ticket_price}*{num_vip_tickets}={vip_total}>>{vip_total}.
The 3 regular tickets amount to ${regular_ticket_price} x {num_regular_tickets} = $<<{regular_ticket_price}*{num_regular_tickets}={regular_total}>>{regular_total}.
Thus, the total cost of the tickets is ${vip_total} + ${regular_total} = $<<{vip_total}+{regular_total}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
Therefore, Mrs. Wilsborough is left with ${initial_savings} - ${total_cost} = $<<{initial_savings}-{total_cost}={savings_left}>>{savings_left} of her savings.
